snippet: It is astounding, the author writes, how little risk the markets are pricing into public companies that have poured shareholder money into emerging markets over the last several years through acquisitions and start-up projects.
abstract: It is astounding, the author writes, how little risk the markets are pricing into public companies that have poured shareholder money into emerging markets over the last several years through acquisitions and start-up projects.

headline.main: Adventures Abroad Could Hurt U.S. Companies
